description: Retrieves the details of a maintenance window task. To retrieve a list of tasks in a maintenance window, instead use the  DescribeMaintenanceWindowTasks command.

parameters.name: WindowId
parameters.description: The maintenance window ID that includes the task to retrieve.

parameters.name: WindowTaskId
parameters.description: The maintenance window task ID to retrieve.

nested_items.name: WindowId
nested_items.description: The retrieved maintenance window ID.

nested_items.name: WindowTaskId
nested_items.description: The retrieved maintenance window task ID.

nested_items.name: Targets
nested_items.description: The targets where the task should run.
Key=tag-key,Values=tag-value-1,tag-value-2

nested_items.name: TaskArn
nested_items.description: The resource that the task used during execution. For RUN_COMMAND and AUTOMATION task types, the value of TaskArn is the SSM document name/ARN. For LAMBDA tasks, the value is the function name/ARN. For STEP_FUNCTIONS tasks, the value is the state machine ARN.

nested_items.name: ServiceRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role for Amazon Web Services Systems Manager to assume when running a maintenance window task. If you do not specify a service role ARN, Systems Manager uses a service-linked role in your account. If no appropriate service-linked role for Systems Manager exists in your account, it is created when you run RegisterTaskWithMaintenanceWindow.

nested_items.name: TaskType
nested_items.description: The type of task to run.

nested_items.name: TaskParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters to pass to the task when it runs.

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: Values
nested_items.description: This field contains an array of 0 or more strings, each 1 to 255 characters in length.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: TaskInvocationParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters to pass to the task when it runs.

nested_items.name: RunCommand
nested_items.description: The parameters for a RUN_COMMAND task type.

nested_items.name: Comment
nested_items.description: Information about the commands to run.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchOutputConfig
nested_items.description: Configuration options for sending command output to Amazon CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: CloudWatchLogGroupName
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch Logs log group where you want to send command output. If you don't specify a group name, Amazon Web Services Systems Manager automatically creates a log group for you. The log group uses the following naming format:

nested_items.name: CloudWatchOutputEnabled
nested_items.description: Enables Systems Manager to send command output to CloudWatch Logs.

nested_items.name: DocumentHash
nested_items.description: The SHA-256 or SHA-1 hash created by the system when the document was created. SHA-1 hashes have been deprecated.

nested_items.name: DocumentHashType
nested_items.description: SHA-256 or SHA-1. SHA-1 hashes have been deprecated.

nested_items.name: DocumentVersion
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Systems Manager document (SSM document) version to use in the request. You can specify $DEFAULT, $LATEST, or a specific version number. If you run commands by using the Amazon Web Services CLI, then you must escape the first two options by using a backslash. If you specify a version number, then you don't need to use the backslash. For example:

nested_items.name: NotificationConfig
nested_items.description: Configurations for sending notifications about command status changes on a per-managed node basis.

nested_items.name: NotificationArn
nested_items.description: An Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for an Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic. Run Command pushes notifications about command status changes to this topic.

nested_items.name: NotificationEvents
nested_items.description: The different events for which you can receive notifications. To learn more about these events, see Monitoring Systems Manager status changes using Amazon SNS notifications in the Amazon Web Services Systems Manager User Guide.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: NotificationType
nested_items.description: The type of notification.
Command: Receive notification when the status of a command changes.
Invocation: For commands sent to multiple managed nodes, receive notification on a per-node basis when the status of a command changes.

nested_items.name: OutputS3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket.

nested_items.name: OutputS3KeyPrefix
nested_items.description: The S3 bucket subfolder.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: The parameters for the RUN_COMMAND task execution.
(string) ---
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ServiceRoleArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM service role for Amazon Web Services Systems Manager to assume when running a maintenance window task. If you do not specify a service role ARN, Systems Manager uses a service-linked role in your account. If no appropriate service-linked role for Systems Manager exists in your account, it is created when you run RegisterTaskWithMaintenanceWindow.

nested_items.name: TimeoutSeconds
nested_items.description: If this time is reached and the command hasn't already started running, it doesn't run.

nested_items.name: Automation
nested_items.description: The parameters for an AUTOMATION task type.

nested_items.name: DocumentVersion
nested_items.description: The version of an Automation runbook to use during task execution.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: The parameters for the AUTOMATION task.
(string) ---
(list) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: StepFunctions
nested_items.description: The parameters for a STEP_FUNCTIONS task type.

nested_items.name: Input
nested_items.description: The inputs for the STEP_FUNCTIONS task.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the STEP_FUNCTIONS task.

nested_items.name: ClientContext
nested_items.description: Pass client-specific information to the Lambda function that you are invoking. You can then process the client information in your Lambda function as you choose through the context variable.

nested_items.name: Qualifier
nested_items.description: (Optional) Specify an Lambda function version or alias name. If you specify a function version, the operation uses the qualified function Amazon Resource Name (ARN) to invoke a specific Lambda function. If you specify an alias name, the operation uses the alias ARN to invoke the Lambda function version to which the alias points.

nested_items.name: Payload
nested_items.description: JSON to provide to your Lambda function as input.

nested_items.name: Priority
nested_items.description: The priority of the task when it runs. The lower the number, the higher the priority. Tasks that have the same priority are scheduled in parallel.

nested_items.name: MaxConcurrency
nested_items.description: The maximum number of targets allowed to run this task in parallel.

nested_items.name: MaxErrors
nested_items.description: The maximum number of errors allowed before the task stops being scheduled.

nested_items.name: LoggingInfo
nested_items.description: The location in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) where the task results are logged.

nested_items.name: S3BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of an S3 bucket where execution logs are stored.

nested_items.name: S3KeyPrefix
nested_items.description: (Optional) The S3 bucket subfolder.

nested_items.name: S3Region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region where the S3 bucket is located.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The retrieved task name.

nested_items.name: Description
nested_items.description: The retrieved task description.

nested_items.name: CutoffBehavior
nested_items.description: The action to take on tasks when the maintenance window cutoff time is reached. CONTINUE_TASK means that tasks continue to run. For Automation, Lambda, Step Functions tasks, CANCEL_TASK means that currently running task invocations continue, but no new task invocations are started. For Run Command tasks, CANCEL_TASK means the system attempts to stop the task by sending a CancelCommand operation.

nested_items.name: AlarmConfiguration
nested_items.description: The details for the CloudWatch alarm you applied to your maintenance window task.

nested_items.name: IgnorePollAlarmFailure
nested_items.description: When this value is true, your automation or command continues to run in cases where we can't retrieve alarm status information from CloudWatch. In cases where we successfully retrieve an alarm status of OK or INSUFFICIENT_DATA, the automation or command continues to run, regardless of this value. Default is false.

nested_items.name: Alarms
nested_items.description: The name of the CloudWatch alarm specified in the configuration.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of your CloudWatch alarm.
